data.message: Love it thank you lyrically touching my soul again grown with you Marshall and I'm one female who can relate and is truly grateful for your honesty your lyrical talent is a gift of which may have come from a harsh reality too many of us go through alone and lyrically so touching raw and honest its relatable and often so relevant to my own timeline of life my children have grown up with your music and had the pleasure of you live in New Zealand but my proudest moment came on the release of headlights my son called me to play it for me crying regardless of the haters they're in all walks and streets of life we are a family who have grown with you adore you and unite through your music and that in itself is truly unique for which I am most thankful for arohanui always KIA KAHA Marshall you're a true legend far stronger and greater than you could ever imagine (rap god included) saddest thing in life is that true legends are only ever truly immortalized once they are no more
